meanings.definition: The bundles of fibers that transmit impulses between the brain and other parts of the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained how the nerves carry messages from the brain.
meanings.sent2: She felt a tingling sensation as the nerves in her hand started to heal.
meanings.sent3: The nerves in the electrical wires seemed to have a mind of their own, causing flickering lights.
meanings.sent4: His words struck a nerve, making her realize the truth of his statement.
meanings.sent5: The dancer moved with such precision, as if every nerve in her body was perfectly in tune.

meanings.definition: The ability to face danger or fear without showing it.
meanings.sent1: Despite the danger, he showed incredible nerves and remained calm.
meanings.sent2: Her nerves of steel helped her navigate through the challenging situation.
meanings.sent3: The nerves of the superhero never failed, even in the face of the most menacing villains.
meanings.sent4: Facing the roaring crowd, the singer gathered her nerves and belted out a flawless performance.
meanings.sent5: The nerves of the firefighter were tested as he entered the burning building to save lives.

meanings.definition: A state of nervousness or agitation.
meanings.sent1: Her nerves were on edge as she waited for the exam results.
meanings.sent2: He tried to calm his nerves before the important presentation.
meanings.sent3: The nerves of the cat were evident as it anxiously paced back and forth.
meanings.sent4: The nerves in the room were palpable as everyone awaited the announcement.
meanings.sent5: The nerves of the detective were heightened as he approached the suspect for questioning.
